intro: Isoloma hondense, commonly known as the Honduran isoloma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Honduras. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
